name: biomass
description: Biomass is a renewable energy source derived from organic materials, such as plants and animal waste. It can be used to produce heat, electricity, and biofuels.

name: water
description: Water is a vital resource for all living organisms. It is used for drinking, irrigation, and industrial processes. Freshwater resources are limited and need to be managed sustainably.

name: toxins
description: Toxins are harmful substances that can cause damage to living organisms and the environment. They can be found in various forms, including chemicals, heavy metals, and biological agents.

name: minerals
description: Minerals are naturally occurring inorganic substances that are essential for various biological processes. They can be found in rocks, soil, and water.
